io.proximax.dfms.model.drive

Interface DriveContent

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseContent, ByteArrayContent, DirectoryContent, FileSystemContent, InputStreamContent

    public interface DriveContent
    Representation of the hierarchical data in the DFMS. Can represent either some data (e.g. file) or a node in hierarchy (e.g. directory)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static DriveContent from(java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> name, byte[] content)
      create new content defined by byte array
      static DriveContent from(java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> name, java.io.InputStream inputStream)
      create new content defined by input stream
      static DriveContent from(java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> name, java.util.List<DriveContent> children)
      create new content as a directory of other content instances
      static DriveContent from(java.nio.file.Path path)
      create new content defined as path.
      java.util.List<DriveContent> getChildren()
      get child nodes representing directory-like structure
      java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
      Get input stream with the content of this node.
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getName()
      get the name of the node
      boolean isNode()
      check whether this node represents node (does not have content but has children) or content

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getName()
        get the name of the node
        Returns:
        the name

      • isNode

        boolean isNode()
        check whether this node represents node (does not have content but has children) or content
        Returns:
        true if node represents directory, false otherwise

      • getInputStream

        java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
                            throws java.io.IOException

        Get input stream with the content of this node.

        Note that some implementations (e.g. directory) do not have content directly but in child nodes. In such case this method will throw runtime exception. Use isNode() to check whether this node is directory

        Returns:
        the input stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when content is not available

      • getChildren

        java.util.List<DriveContent> getChildren()
        get child nodes representing directory-like structure
        Returns:
        the child nodes

      • from

        static DriveContent from(java.nio.file.Path path)
        create new content defined as path. Can be directory or file. See FileSystemContent for details
        Parameters:
        path - the path to represent
        Returns:
        the instance of storage content

      • from

        static DriveContent from(java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> name,
                         byte[] content)
        create new content defined by byte array
        Parameters:
        name - optional name of the content
        content - the actual bytes of the data
        Returns:
        the instance of the storage content

      • from

        static DriveContent from(java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> name,
                         java.util.List<DriveContent> children)
        create new content as a directory of other content instances
        Parameters:
        name - optional name of the content
        children - list of child content instances
        Returns:
        the instance of the storage content

      • from

        static DriveContent from(java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> name,
                         java.io.InputStream inputStream)
        create new content defined by input stream
        Parameters:
        name - optional name of the content
        inputStream - input stream with content data
        Returns:
        the instance of the storage content
